alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 11:26AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Central Inner Channels and Eastern Gulf Coast. This includes the cities of Sitka, Juneau, And Petersburg. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Some landslides in steeper terrain could be possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An atmospheric river will bring heavy rainfall in the range of 2 to 4 inches to the central and northern panhandle. Heaviest rainfall is expected for the northern panhandle starting Wed night and continuing into Thursday. For the central panhandle, the heaviest rainfall will start early Thursday morning and continue into Thursday night. Minor flooding is possible especially for the smaller streams. There is some uncertainty on when exactly the rainfall will end with the earliest end being Thursday night, but the rain could last into early Friday with enhanced effects due to the longer duration of the rainfall. In addition, the heavy rainfall combined with some gusty winds from this system could cause some steeper mountain slopes to become unstable. Be alert for some possible landslides. - Stay away from steep barren hillsides due to the landslide danger. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; Petersburg Borough
